column2: Architecture & Design
Do the application or platform support atleast 85% of requirements as out-of-box solutions?
column4: Yes, the application/platform supports more than 95% of the requirements as out-of-box solutions, ensuring rapid deployment and minimal customization. This high level of out-of-box functionality helps streamline the implementation process and reduces the need for extensive adjustments.

column2: Are the core functions are modular by Design?
column4: Fuze’s modular service architecture is designed for seamless integration with external systems. All core functions are accessible via APIs,SDKs - many of which are external-facing. As a result, the ability to integrate with an external system depends on the specific system in question and the scale of integration required by the merchant.

column2: s
column4: Fuze Finance offers two integration options to meet diverse business needs: a hosted solution and a comprehensive API/SDK suite. The hosted solution is a ready-to-deploy platform that ensures security, scalability, and seamless operation with minimal development effort required. For businesses seeking more customization, the API/SDK suite provides extensive functionality and robust developer support, including detailed documentation and sandbox environments for smooth integration. Both options offer exceptional flexibility and ease of use.  For the user interface, Fuze collaborates closely with the bank's design team to ensure the UI is fully aligned with the bank’s branding while adhering to industry best practices. The design is optimized for the highest conversion rates, providing an intuitive and device-enabled experience suitable for both new and advanced users. Key features like simplified navigation, responsive design, and accessible layouts ensure a user-friendly interface across all customer segments. Usability testing is conducted regularly to ensure the interface consistently meets user expectations and delivers an optimal experience.

column2: Do the solution demonstrate data quality checks at each layer of the design?
column4: Fuze implements multiple layers of data quality checks throughout the design. Each request undergoes filtering through Cloudflare request filtering, AWS ALB filtering, and application-level data type validation before being processed by internal services. These checks ensure data integrity and quality at every stage of the process.

column2: Assess the Cross Platform Integration with Mashreq Landscape core application if the requirement needs Mashreq Application interaction. (Eg:- API Connect, Data Lake, Etc.)
column4: Fuze is designed with flexibility, scalability, and security at its core. The API infrastructure follows a 'plug & play' approach, enabling seamless integration with external systems, including Mashreq's core applications. BrokerX utilizes a modular architecture, allowing banks to customize their strategy for deploying different products. It supports integration through REST APIs, WebSockets, and white-labeled web apps, ensuring rapid implementation and smooth interaction with Mashreq’s landscape. Furthermore, Fuze is built on an event-based architecture, allowing for the easy creation of new microservices that can consume events and provide additional features as required, ensuring long-term adaptability and efficient data flow.

column2: Do the Application or Platform demonstrate security design with Zero Trust Principles?
column4: Yes, Fuze platform is built using Zero Trust principles, leveraging TailScale and a mesh-based VPN on Wireguard to enforce strict security measures.  Zero Trust Architecture: Every request, regardless of origin or endpoint, is subject to strict verification. Users and devices must be authenticated, authorized, and continuously validated before access to any resources is granted.  Encryption: All API communications are secured using TLS 1.3 and AES-256 encryption, ensuring both data confidentiality and integrity.  Authentication: Supports secure user and system authentication using API keys and JWT tokens.  Access Controls: Implements Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) and Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) to restrict API access based on user roles, permissions, and attributes.  Rate Limiting and Throttling: Protects APIs from abuse or denial-of-service (DoS) attacks by limiting request rates.  Audit Logging: Tracks all API interactions for compliance, monitoring, and forensic analysis.  IP Whitelisting: Restricts API access to pre-approved IP addresses, ensuring only trusted sources can interact with the system.  Continuous Monitoring and Threat Detection: Real-time monitoring of API traffic using AI-driven tools to detect anomalies and prevent unauthorized activities.  By integrating these advanced security measures with a Zero Trust policy, Fuze ensures that its platform APIs provide the highest level of security, trust, and compliance for all integrations and data exchanges.

column2: Does the solution provide SaaS offering?
column4: Yes, Fuze offers a comprehensive SaaS solution.

column2: If yes, where the SaaS solution is deployed?(with-in GCC or outside GCC region. Specify location)
column4: Yes, the SaaS solution is deployed on AWS Middle East (ME) Central, located in the UAE.

column2: Is the solution/platform or application demonstrate Cloud Native design? Also, giving a Flexibility in hosting the solution (On-Premise, Hybrid, Cloud)
column4: In both SaaS and self-hosted deployment models, Fuze ensures that Mashreq’s data is stored securely and in full compliance with regulatory requirements. Below is a detailed breakdown of where Mashreq’s data will be stored, the physical location of the repositories, and the retention periods for personal information (PI) and other data types:  1. Data Storage Locations Mashreq’s data will be stored in the following repositories, depending on the deployment model:  a. SaaS Deployment In the SaaS model, Fuze hosts and manages the platform on AWS UAE (me-central-1 region), ensuring that all data remains within the UAE. The specific storage locations include:  Databases: The primary database utilizes Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) to store transactional data, customer information, and compliance logs.  Object Storage: Amazon S3 is used for storing large files, such as KYC documents, audit logs, and backup data.  Backup Storage: Backup data is stored in Amazon S3, with geographically redundant copies within the UAE to ensure data durability and availability.  b. Self-Hosted Deployment In the self-hosted model, Mashreq hosts the platform within its own AWS UAE tenant, maintaining full control over data storage. The specific storage locations include:  Databases: Mashreq may use its own Amazon RDS Database instances to store transactional data, customer information, and compliance logs.  Object Storage: Mashreq can use its own Amazon S3 Storage instances for storing large files, such as KYC documents and audit logs.  Backup Storage: Mashreq can configure its own backup storage within Amazon S3 Storage, ensuring that backup data remains within the UAE.  2. Physical Location of Repositories All data repositories are physically located within the UAE, ensuring compliance with UAE data localization requirements. Specifically:  AWS UAE (me-central-1 region): All data stored in AWS UAE is hosted in data centers within the UAE.  3. Data Retention Periods Fuze adheres to regulatory requirements and industry best practices for data retention. The retention periods for different types of data are as follows:  Personal Information (PI) Retention Period: Personal information is retained for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law. For example, KYC data is retained for 8 years after the customer relationship ends, in compliance with AML/CFT regulations. Transaction records are retained for 8 years, in compliance with VARA and SCA regulations.  Transaction Data Retention Period: Transaction data, including trade execution details, is retained for 8 years, in compliance with regulatory requirements.  Compliance Data Retention Period: Compliance data, including KYC/AML records, audit logs, and suspicious activity reports (SARs), is retained for 8 years, in compliance with regulatory requirements.  Backup Data Retention Period: Backup data is retained for 8 years, ensuring that data can be restored in the event of a failure or data loss.  Archival Data Retention Period: Archival data is retained based on custom policies defined by Mashreq, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and business needs.  4. Data Deletion and Purge Fuze ensures that data is securely deleted when it is no longer needed. Key features include:  Secure Deletion: Data is securely deleted using industry-standard data sanitization methods, ensuring that it cannot be recovered once purged.  Compliance with Regulatory Requirements: Fuze’s data deletion processes comply with GDPR’s right to erasure and UAE PDPL, ensuring that data is deleted in a timely and compliant manner.  Audit Logging: All data deletion activities are logged, providing a comprehensive audit trail for compliance and troubleshooting purposes.  This version retains the technical details while presenting them in a polished and sophisticated manner. Let me know if you need further adjustments!

column2: Do Application or Platform support both Linux and Windows operating system to deploy
column4: Fuze supports deployment exclusively on the Linux operating system. Windows is not supported for deployment. However, the back-office software and the application are web-based and fully supported across all platforms.

column2: Is the Backup & Storage design supports flexibility of using Cloud or Simple storage options?
column4: Yes, Fuze’s platform supports flexible backup and storage options, offering both cloud-based and simple storage solutions to meet diverse customer needs. Below are the key details about Fuze’s data management capabilities, designed to ensure data integrity, regulatory compliance, and efficient storage resource management:  1. Automated Backup Fuze’s platform includes automated backup processes to ensure data is regularly backed up and can be restored in the event of failure or data loss. Key features include:  Frequent Backups: Fuze performs daily backups of critical data, including customer information, transaction records, and compliance logs. Incremental backups are performed to minimize storage usage and enhance efficiency.  Point-in-Time Recovery (PITR): Fuze supports PITR, allowing the bank to restore data to a specific point in time, minimizing data loss during an incident.  Geographically Redundant Storage: Backups are stored in geographically redundant locations to ensure data availability during regional outages or disasters.  Encryption: All backup data is encrypted with AES-256 encryption, ensuring protection against unauthorized access.  2. Data Archival Fuze’s platform provides automated archival processes to manage the storage of historical data. Key features include:  Archival Policies: Fuze allows the bank to define custom archival policies based on regulatory requirements and business needs.  Compliance with Regulatory Requirements: Archival processes are designed to comply with regulations like GDPR, UAE PDPL, and AML/CFT, ensuring data is retained for the required periods.  Efficient Storage Management: Archived data is stored in cost-effective storage solutions, such as cold storage, minimizing costs while maintaining data availability.  Search and Retrieval: Archived data can be easily searched and retrieved using Fuze’s dashboard (FuzeOS) or APIs, allowing the bank to access historical data when needed.  3. Data Purge Fuze’s platform supports automated data purge processes, ensuring that data is securely deleted when no longer needed. Key features include:  Purge Policies: Fuze allows the bank to define custom purge policies based on regulatory and business needs.  Secure Deletion: Data is deleted using industry-standard data sanitization methods, ensuring it cannot be recovered once purged.  Compliance with Regulatory Requirements: Purge processes are designed to comply with regulatory requirements, including GDPR’s right to erasure and UAE PDPL, ensuring timely and compliant data deletion.  Audit Logging: All data purge activities are logged, providing a comprehensive audit trail for compliance and troubleshooting.  4. Data Management Dashboard (FuzeOS) Fuze’s proprietary dashboard (FuzeOS) offers a centralized interface for managing backup, archival, and purge processes. Key features include:  Policy Management: The bank can define and manage backup, archival, and purge policies via FuzeOS, ensuring alignment with regulatory and business requirements.  Monitoring and Reporting: FuzeOS provides real-time monitoring and reporting of data management activities, offering full visibility into backup, archival, and purge processes.  Compliance Reporting: FuzeOS generates compliance reports to demonstrate adherence to regulatory requirements during audits.  This flexible approach to storage and backup ensures that Fuze’s platform can adapt to the varying needs of customers while maintaining high standards of data security, compliance, and operational efficiency.

column2: What is the Tech Stack used in the solution?
column4: Fuze’s system architecture is designed to be flexible, scalable, and secure, leveraging cloud infrastructure from leading providers to ensure high availability, reliability, and rapid scaling.  Cloud Providers and Locations: Fuze operates primarily on AWS cloud infrastructure, with its services hosted in the AWS me-central-1 region, ensuring full compliance with UAE data protection laws. The architecture incorporates geographic redundancy and high availability across multiple availability zones (AZs), guaranteeing seamless operations even in the face of disruptions.  Service Providers: Fuze integrates with key service providers to enhance security and compliance across the digital asset lifecycle. These include Fireblocks for custody services, Chainalysis for compliance, and Notabene for Travel Rule compliance. The platform supports a flexible, plug-and-play architecture, allowing for integration with multiple custody providers, Travel Rule providers, and KYT/AML providers.  Tech Stack: Fuze's platform is built on a microservices-based architecture, enabling modularity and flexibility. The system utilizes an event-driven Pub/Sub mechanism to facilitate both horizontal and vertical scaling. The core components of the tech stack include:  SOR and OEMS: Fuze uses a proprietary Order Execution Management System (OEMS) and Smart Order Routing (SOR) system. The SOR ensures trades are routed to the best venue based on parameters such as slippage, price, and volume, while the OEMS manages the entire order lifecycle. Fuze is an unbiased liqudity as an agnostic technolgoy platform with a smart order router that uses machine intellignece to acquire crypto at the best executed price for its customers.  APIs: REST APIs and WebSockets are employed for real-time communication and trading, ensuring seamless interaction between systems and external platforms.  Databases: High-performance databases like PostgreSQL are used for transactional data, while DynamoDB supports high-availability document storage. Additionally, timeseries databases such as InfluxDB are utilized for storing time-sensitive data.  Security: Fuze implements robust security features, including end-to-end encryption, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and security monitoring tools like SIEM, IDS, and IPS, integrated across the platform to ensure the highest level of security.  Disaster Recovery: Fuze maintains a comprehensive disaster recovery strategy, including automatic failover and backup mechanisms. Data is stored across multiple Availability Zones to prevent loss, and the disaster recovery plan is tested quarterly to ensure preparedness. A Business Continuity Planning (BCP) cluster is also in place, ensuring continuity in the event of AWS unavailability in the UAE.  Bankruptcy: Fuze is fully bankruptcy remote - In the case of a liquidation process involving Fuze’s clients assets, Fuze alongside the Financial Institution (FI) can provide claim capabilities to their end clients without undergoing any court proceedings.  Effectively, through Fuze’s request, Custodian would transfer the respective assets into Fuze’s liquidation engine that sells and transfers AED into a Mashreq's designated account, where customers can be settled.   Utilization of Smart Contracts: Custody and Asset Management: Smart contracts are employed to manage digital asset custody, ensuring assets are locked, transferred, or released only when predefined conditions are met. This enhances both security and compliance with regulatory policies.  Tokenized Assets: Fuze facilitates the integration of tokenized real-world assets, such as real estate or commodities, through smart contracts, allowing for transparent and secure asset transfers on the blockchain.  This robust architecture, along with the strategic use of smart contracts, enables Fuze to deliver secure, scalable, and compliant services, maintaining a high standard of security and operational efficiency.  Custody Providers: Fuze has a multi vendor approach to Custody, including Hex Trust (regulated by VARA), Tungsten (recently acquired by Zodia Custody) and Fireblocks

column2: Does the solution aligns with Local central bank ring fencing policies? (UAE, Egypt mainly)
column4: Fuze's solutions follow all the applicable ring fencing policies as set out by the Central Bank

column2: Do the application or platform demonstrate clear Business Continuity design?
column4: Yes, Fuze's platform demonstrates a clear and robust Business Continuity (BC) design. The system is built to ensure uninterrupted service availability and operational resilience, even in the event of disruptions or disasters. Key components of the Business Continuity design include:  1. Disaster Recovery and Failover Mechanisms Automatic Failover: Fuze’s infrastructure is designed with automatic failover capabilities to ensure that operations continue smoothly in case of a failure in any single system or availability zone.  Geographically Redundant Storage: Data is stored in multiple Availability Zones (AZs) within AWS, offering geographic redundancy. This ensures that if one region experiences an outage, the data remains accessible from other locations.  Quarterly Testing: Fuze conducts quarterly disaster recovery drills to test the effectiveness of its failover and recovery procedures, ensuring readiness in case of critical incidents.  2. Data Backups and Availability Automated Backups: The platform performs daily incremental backups of critical data, ensuring data integrity and availability for recovery.  Geographically Redundant Backup Storage: Backup data is stored across different locations within the UAE, ensuring its durability and availability, even in the event of localized failures.  3. Business Continuity Planning (BCP) Cluster BCP Cluster in UAE: Fuze has implemented a dedicated Business Continuity Planning (BCP) cluster, ensuring that operations can quickly switch over to this backup system if the primary infrastructure becomes unavailable.  Real-Time Monitoring: Fuze uses real-time monitoring tools to ensure any disruptions are immediately detected, allowing for quick recovery actions and minimizing downtime.  4. Compliance with Local Regulations Fuze's business continuity processes adhere to local regulations and compliance standards, ensuring that it meets the UAE Central Bank's regulatory requirements for operational resilience.  In summary, Fuze’s platform is designed with multiple layers of redundancy, robust disaster recovery procedures, and a comprehensive Business Continuity Plan to ensure continuous service availability and operational security.

column2: Does the solution Support Low code No code? If yes, kindly detail the limitations from tech view
column4: Fuze enables the creation of dashboards on top of its data through No Code/Low Code integrations. We have utilized Appsmith to develop the complete internal dashboard infrastructure. In addition to FuzeOS, which serves as the primary back-office solution, Fuze will provide an integration and maintenance engineer to assist in building and customizing these dashboards as needed.

column2: Does the solution support out-of-the-box workflows or can be integrated to Mashreq workflow system?
column4: Fuze does not offer out-of-the-box workflows. However, FuzeOS serves as a comprehensive back-office solution, providing a unified platform for finance, customer support, and reporting. Should there be a need for custom workflows, Fuze’s experienced development team is available to build and integrate tailored workflows to meet Mashreq’s specific requirements.

column2: Does the solution provide SFTP approach?
column4: Yes, Fuze provides an SFTP approach for secure file transfers.

column2: Tech, Components and Integration
Is the solution or platform extensible with customization? Minimal custom dev.?
column4: Fuze was designed with flexibility, scalability, and security at its core. The platform’s API infrastructure follows a 'plug & play' approach, facilitating seamless integrations. BrokerX is built with a modular architecture, allowing banks to define their strategy for launching various products. It supports integration via REST APIs, WebSockets, and white-labeled web applications, ensuring quick implementation. Moreover, Fuze leverages an event-based architecture, making it easy to spin up new microservices to consume events and deliver additional features with minimal custom development.

column2: Is the platform offers all out-of-box capabilities as a flexible & modular service ?
column4: Yes, the Fuze platform offers its capabilities as a flexible and modular service, although the extent of "out-of-box" flexibility for all features can be discussed.

column2: Are all or core functions are exposed as service or API from the platform?
column4: Yes, all core functions of the platform are exposed as services or APIs. Fuze is built with a service-oriented architecture, where key functionalities such as trading, customer management, compliance checks, and reporting are accessible via REST APIs. This allows for seamless integration with external systems and enables businesses to leverage the platform’s capabilities while maintaining flexibility in their operations. The modular approach ensures that each core function can be accessed independently as needed, providing a highly scalable and customizable solution.

column2: Is the solution flexible supporting approved software stacks at Mashreq (Database, Cache, Middleware, Workflow System, etc?)
column4: Fuze is capable of supporting a wide range of software stacks. However, to provide a definitive answer, we would need to understand the specific details of Mashreq's approved software stack, including the database, cache, middleware, workflow system, and other relevant technologies.

column2: Is the solution design demonstrate integration with IAM/ Access management solutions?
column4: Yes, the solution is designed to integrate with Identity and Access Management (IAM) and access control solutions. Fuze supports seamless integration with various IAM systems, enabling centralized user authentication, authorization, and role-based access control (RBAC). This ensures that access to platform resources is securely managed, with fine-grained control over user roles and permissions, aligning with organizational security policies and compliance requirements.

column2: Do you support outbound & inbound APIs for an easy integration? Is the external or 3rd party integrations are through API's?
column4: Yes, Fuze supports both outbound and inbound APIs, facilitating easy integration with external systems. External and third-party integrations are primarily handled through APIs, allowing seamless data exchange and interoperability with various platforms and services. This API-first approach ensures that Fuze can integrate efficiently with other systems, enabling smooth workflows and enhancing the platform’s overall flexibility.

column2: Does it also support batch data processing?
column4: Yes, Fuze supports batch data processing. The platform is designed to handle large volumes of data efficiently, allowing for scheduled batch processing of data at specified intervals. This ensures that bulk data can be processed in a streamlined manner, minimizing the impact on real-time operations and maintaining overall system performance.

column2: Support Security standards. Data in transit and rest to be encrypted, https, TLS3.0 & above, oath, etc.
column4: Yes, Fuze supports robust security standards to ensure data protection both in transit and at rest. Key security features include:  Data Encryption: All data in transit is encrypted using HTTPS with TLS 1.2 (or above), ensuring secure communication between systems. Data at rest is encrypted using industry-standard encryption protocols (e.g., AES-256).  Authentication & Authorization: Fuze integrates strong authentication mechanisms such as OAuth for secure access control, ensuring that only authorized users can access sensitive data and resources.  Compliance with Security Standards: The platform adheres to best practices and industry standards for security, ensuring that data is protected from unauthorized access, integrity breaches, and other security threats.  These features ensure that Fuze meets the highest security standards and compliance requirements for data protection.

column2: Do you support standard integration best-practices like throttling, circuit-breaking. Please explain.
column4: Yes, Fuze employs a multi-layered security approach to protect against DDoS attacks. The first layer of defense is provided by Cloudflare DDoS protection. In addition, Fuze utilizes AWS ALB (Application Load Balancer) with multiple rulesets to filter out spam and bot behaviors. Finally, the application incorporates advanced throttling, rate limiting, and circuit breakers to manage incoming requests effectively. The platform is built for scalability, leveraging a horizontally scalable Pub/Sub event-based architecture, which can dynamically scale out to handle increased traffic and request loads.

column2: Digital Channels support & simplified UI's for functions (onboarding Agency, input forms, Push notifications)
column4: Fuze supports digital channels with simplified UIs for key functions such as onboarding agencies, input forms, and push notifications. The platform offers seamless API integration, ensuring smooth connectivity with external systems, while delivering a best-in-class UI/UX designed to enhance user experience across various use cases.

column2: Do the solution support smart alerts & notifications for the business required function?
column4: Fuze can provide smart alerts and notifications through our FuzeOS platform, ensuring that business-critical functions are monitored and timely notifications are sent based on predefined triggers and requirements.

column2: Do the solution logs can be configured to Splunk?
column4: Fuze features a flexible event-based system with adapters that can push logs to any designated store, including Splunk, as long as there is an accessible HTTP endpoint for data transmission.

column2: Does the solution support easy monitoring with AppDynamics and EgMonitoring?
column4: Fuze does not use AppDynamics or EgMonitoring; instead, we utilize the TIG Stack (Telegraf, Influx, Grafana) for monitoring, along with PagerDuty for incident management. For front-end monitoring, we use Sentry, and for backend monitoring and distributed tracing, we rely on Signoz with OpenTelemetry.

column2: Are there OOB MIS reporting? Does the solution share data with Elastic Search?
column4: The Fuze platform offers FuzeOS, which provides out-of-the-box MIS reporting. Additionally, Fuze integrates OpenSearch (AWS’s version of Elasticsearch), though it is used solely for internal purposes.

column2: Is the Backup & Archival of data is configurable?
column4: Yes, Fuze’s platform provides configurable automated backup, archival, and purge mechanisms for both application and customer data. These features ensure data integrity, compliance with regulatory requirements, and efficient management of storage resources. Below are the key details:  Automated Backup Fuze offers configurable automated backup processes to ensure data is regularly backed up and can be restored in the event of a failure or data loss. Key features include:  Frequent Backups: Daily incremental backups of critical data, such as customer information, transaction records, and compliance logs, to optimize storage and efficiency.  Point-in-Time Recovery (PITR): Allows restoration of data to a specific point in time, minimizing data loss.  Geographically Redundant Storage: Backups are stored in geographically redundant locations for high availability during regional outages or disasters.  Encryption: All backup data is encrypted using AES-256 encryption to prevent unauthorized access.  Data Archival Fuze provides configurable data archival processes to manage historical data storage:  Archival Policies: Customizable policies for archival based on regulatory requirements and business needs.  Compliance: Archival processes align with regulations such as GDPR, UAE PDPL, and AML/CFT, ensuring data is retained for the required period.  Efficient Storage: Archived data is stored in cost-effective solutions, like cold storage, to reduce costs while ensuring availability.  Search and Retrieval: Archived data can be accessed via Fuze’s proprietary dashboard (FuzeOS) or APIs.  Data Purge Fuze’s platform includes customizable data purge processes to securely delete data when no longer required:  Purge Policies: Custom purge policies based on regulatory requirements and business needs.  Secure Deletion: Data is deleted using industry-standard data sanitization methods, ensuring it cannot be recovered.  Compliance: Purge processes comply with regulations like GDPR’s right to erasure and UAE PDPL.  Audit Logging: All purge activities are logged for comprehensive auditing and troubleshooting.  Data Management Dashboard (FuzeOS) FuzeOS offers a centralized interface for managing backup, archival, and purge processes:  Policy Management: The bank can define and manage backup, archival, and purge policies.  Monitoring and Reporting: Real-time monitoring and reporting of activities through FuzeOS.  Compliance Reporting: FuzeOS generates reports to demonstrate compliance during audits.

column2: Is every transaction is auditable?
column4: Yes, every transaction is auditable on the Fuze platform. The system logs all transaction data and activities, ensuring full traceability for compliance and auditing purposes.

column2: Does the solution offers connectors/accelerator(s) as out-of-box?
column4: Fuze offers a set of out-of-the-box connectors and adapters that enable seamless integration with HTTP, webhook, REST, and gRPC endpoints. Based on specific requirements, these adapters can be extended to support additional platforms.

column2: Please share your Mobile and Desktop platform user experince screens for review
column4: Attahced

column2: Does the application support any SDK or connectors for development activities?
column4: Yes, Fuze provides SDKs and connectors to facilitate development activities. These tools enable seamless integration with external systems and platforms, allowing developers to build custom functionalities or extend the platform's capabilities according to specific business needs.

column2: Does the solution use AI components? If yes, please provide the details.
column4: Fuze has recently launched an AI Lab initiative, with plans to pilot AI-driven news and alert features within the app. In addition, Fuze has developed a comprehensive roadmap and several use cases aimed at implementing agentic AI within the blockchain ecosystem, all while ensuring robust guardrails for security and compliance.

column2: Does the solution integrates or provide integration capabilities to external  LLM/Open AI or any AI system? If yes, please provide the details.
column4: Fuze will leverage OpenAI APIs for their AI-based initiatives.

column2: Is the solution regulatory compliant?
column4: Yes, Fuze is fully compliant and authorized to offer B2B2C services to Banks/Financial Institutions/Fintechs.  Fuze Finance stands out as a regulatory leader in the UAE’s fintech landscape, having achieved several key milestones: Secured a full VARA Broker-Dealer license, enabling comprehensive Broker-Dealer and Incidental Custody services. Secured Central Bank of UAE for Retail Payment Services and Card Schemes (RPSCS - Category 3). Additionally, Fuze is the only Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP) in the UAE with alignment and a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from SCA.  This unique position allows regulated entities to offer crypto services without needing to obtain their own license, further solidifying Fuze’s role as a trusted enabler in the digital asset ecosystem.

column2: Non Functionals
Do you support CI/CD pipelines for deployment? Needs Azure DevOps Compatibility.
column4: Yes, Fuze uses CI/CD pipelines for deployment. This pipeline includes automated security checks with static and dynamic code analysis, and vulnerability scanning. The deployment process involves using ECS with Docker containers, automating software installation. Fuze's CI/CD pipeline is self-hosted on its own Runners to ensure data security and can be made Azure compatible.

column2: Do you support upgrading/patching of a specific module without incurring downtime for the other modules?
column4: Yes, Fuze's architecture supports upgrading or patching specific modules without incurring downtime for other module. Fuze employs a micro-service architecture managed with AWS ECS. This design allows for the independent scaling and deployment of individual services. Furthermore, Fuze utilises rolling deployments with a CI/CD pipeline for its daily release schedule. This methodology ensures that updates and patches can be applied incrementally, minimising any potential disruption to the overall system

column2: Do you support automated testing for UI components?
column4: Yes, Fuze supports automated testing as part of its development and deployment processes

column2: Do you support automated testing for API components?
column4: Yes, Fuze supports automated testing as part of its development and deployment processes

column2: Do you support security testing via Veracode?
column4: Yes, Fuze supports automated security testing using Snyk, SAST, semgrep, GitHub Advanced Security. Veracode can be supported if required.

column2: Do you conduct independent security evaluation of the platform through third-party vendors? Eg:- PEN testing
column4: Fuze has engaged a qualified and independent third-party auditor to conduct vulnerability assessments and penetration testing at least annually.  These assessments and tests are also conducted before introducing new systems, applications, or products

column2: Is the solution support cloudy ready deployment model? Eg:- AKS Cluster, Containerization
column4: Fuze is deployed to Amazon ECS through docker containerization through an automated CI/CD pipeline.

column2: Ability to Publish & Manage Device enablement, Control users, Etc.
column4: Fuze OS provides all functionality to activate/freeze users depending on the internal compliance requirements of the bank. Additionally Fuze uses best in class CI/CD systems to deploy our codebase. Fuze also has the ability to track user devices provided the same metadata is provided by the FrontEnd.

column2: Smart Data Sync with ADLS, Hadoop, external sources.
column4: Fuze is built on an event based PubSub mechanism which allows adding adapters to any other external provider which can consume these events to provide Data Sync.

column2: Ability to support scaled up transactions up to 30% higher with no performance issues.
column4: Fuze is built to scale. We have an ECS cluster which supports horizontal scalability of all services which automatically provisions more resources to handle increased load. Fuze can easily support 50% more load without any performance issues.

column2: Ease of implementing DoSA (Denial of Security Attack)?
column4: Fuze uses Cloudflare DDoS protection, and AWS WAF rulesets to implement Denial of Security Attacks apart from application level checks.

column2: Is the solution support High Availability, DR?
column4: Fuze is built with High Availablity in mind. Fuze uses an active/active failover mechanism with it's services spanning three different availability zones in UAE so that even if one AZ goes down, we automatically route requests to the next one. Each component has either an active/active failover or an active/passive failover mechanism including our databases.

column2: Ability to manage the solution through VDI?
column4: Fuze has a competent tech and support team which can assit with any kind of debugging. FuzeOS supports SSO and we provide IP whitelisting as well.

column2: Delivery & Operations
Program Support - Training, Manuals and Communication
column4: Fuze offers a comprehensive support framework to ensure that Mashreq’s team can effectively utilize the platform’s capabilities. This includes training, user manuals, and consistent communication to facilitate smooth onboarding, ongoing use, and troubleshooting. Below are the key components of the program support provided by Fuze:  1. Training Programs Fuze provides a structured training program tailored to Mashreq’s specific needs, ensuring that all users—from technical teams to business users—are proficient in using the platform.  Key Elements: Onboarding Training:  Fuze will deliver comprehensive onboarding training sessions for Mashreq’s internal teams, covering the platform’s architecture, functionalities, APIs, and usage scenarios.  Onboarding sessions will be customized to address specific roles within Mashreq, ensuring that business users and technical teams receive targeted training.  Role-Based Training:  Technical Training: For IT and development teams, focusing on platform integration, customization, API usage, and system architecture.  Business User Training: For end-users involved in transaction management, reporting, and daily operational functions, ensuring they can navigate the system efficiently.  Ongoing Training:  Fuze offers periodic refresher courses and advanced training sessions as the platform evolves. These sessions will focus on new features, updates, and best practices.  Mashreq’s team will have access to webinars, workshops, and self-paced online courses.  Train-the-Trainer:  For Mashreq’s internal trainers, Fuze will provide advanced training to help them deliver in-house training programs to new users.  2. User Manuals and Documentation Fuze provides detailed user manuals and documentation to ensure that Mashreq’s team can effectively operate and troubleshoot the system.  Key Elements: Comprehensive User Guides:  Step-by-step manuals for different functionalities of the platform, such as onboarding, transaction processing, reporting, and integration with other systems.  Detailed API documentation and usage examples for developers.  Quick Start Guides:  Easy-to-understand guides to help Mashreq’s team quickly get up and running with key features of the platform.  System Architecture Documentation:  Detailed technical documentation on Fuze’s system architecture, APIs, and integration protocols, enabling Mashreq’s technical teams to easily integrate with the platform.  Release Notes and Feature Documentation:  Regular updates on new features, system enhancements, and bug fixes will be documented and shared with Mashreq’s team.  Troubleshooting Guides:  Fuze provides an extensive troubleshooting guide for common issues, enabling Mashreq’s support teams to resolve problems quickly.  3. Communication and Support Channels Clear, consistent communication channels will be established to ensure that Mashreq can easily access the support they need.  Key Elements: Support Team:  Fuze provides Mashreq with a support team that can be contacted through email, phone, or support portal with SLA's.  For critical issues, priority escalation will ensure rapid response and resolution.  Service Desk:  Fuze offers a centralized service desk for Mashreq’s team to report issues, request enhancements, and ask questions. The service desk will track all requests and provide real-time updates on resolution status.  Knowledge Base:  Fuze provides a centralized knowledge base with frequently asked questions, troubleshooting steps, best practices, and detailed platform documentation. This knowledge base will be continuously updated with new content based on feedback and platform updates.  User Forums and Community: Fuze will also organize annual user conferences and webinars to keep Mashreq informed about the latest developments in the platform.  4. Ongoing Communication Fuze ensures continuous communication to keep Mashreq informed about updates, system changes, and any potential impacts.  Key Elements: Release Notifications:  Fuze will notify Mashreq ahead of any major updates or system changes, ensuring that they are prepared for any new functionality or adjustments to the platform.  Feature Roadmap:  Fuze will provide Mashreq with access to a feature roadmap that outlines upcoming enhancements and planned system changes. This will help Mashreq plan for future updates and ensure alignment with business goals.  Post-Implementation Reviews:  After deployment, Fuze will conduct post-implementation reviews with Mashreq to evaluate the success of the integration, identify areas for improvement, and ensure that training and resources are being fully utilized.  5. Feedback and Continuous Improvement Fuze values Mashreq’s input and will actively seek feedback to enhance the platform and user experience.  Key Elements: Surveys and Feedback Loops:  Regular surveys will be conducted to gather feedback on training, platform usability, and overall satisfaction.  User Group Sessions:  Fuze will host user group sessions for Mashreq’s team to discuss platform usage, share best practices, and gather insights on any challenges faced.  Enhancement Requests:  Mashreq’s team can submit requests for platform enhancements, and Fuze will evaluate and prioritize these requests based on feasibility and alignment with the platform’s roadmap.  By providing structured training, comprehensive manuals, and clear communication, Fuze ensures that Mashreq’s team is well-equipped to maximize the value of the platform, while also maintaining continuous support and feedback loops for ongoing improvement.

Integration with core systems and APIs.  Customization and Development (3-4 weeks): Customization to align with Mashreq’s specific needs. Development of any required workflows or connectors.  Testing and Validation (2-3 weeks): Extensive testing to ensure functionality, security, and performance. User acceptance testing (UAT) with Mashreq.  Deployment and Go-Live (1-2 weeks): Final deployment of the solution.  Monitoring and post-deployment support.  Fuze is flexible and can align its delivery timelines with Mashreq's specific needs, based on mutual evaluation and project scope. column2: Annual Maintenance Contract (AMC) model
column4: Fuze offers an Annual Maintenance Contract (AMC) model designed to ensure the ongoing health, performance, and reliability of the platform. The AMC includes the following key features:  Regular System Updates and Patches:  Fuze will provide regular software updates, security patches, and bug fixes to keep the system secure and up to date with the latest enhancements.  Technical Support:  Access to technical support to address any issues that may arise. Support can be provided remotely or on-site as required.  System Monitoring:  Continuous monitoring of the platform to ensure optimal performance. Fuze will proactively address any system inefficiencies or potential issues before they impact operations.  Token Migration:  Support token migration  Performance Optimization: Periodic performance assessments and optimization recommendations to ensure that the platform meets evolving business requirements.  Training and Knowledge Transfer:  Fuze will provide periodic training sessions to ensure that Mashreq’s team is well-equipped to use and maintain the platform effectively. This can include training on new features and best practices.  Service Level Agreement (SLA):  The AMC will include clear SLAs detailing response times, resolution times, and escalation procedures for all types of issues. Priority levels will be established based on the urgency of the issue.  Disaster Recovery and Backup Support:  Regular testing and validation of disaster recovery processes, ensuring that backups are performed correctly and that the system can be restored in case of a failure.  Compliance Reporting: STR and other regulatory reportings.  The AMC is designed to provide peace of mind by ensuring that the platform is always operating efficiently, securely, and in alignment with Mashreq’s evolving business needs.

column2: Service Level Agreements
column4: Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for Fuze Platform Fuze offers a comprehensive Service Level Agreement (SLA) to ensure that Mashreq receives high-quality service and operational support. The SLA defines clear expectations regarding the platform’s uptime, performance, and support response times. Below are the key components of Fuze's SLA:  1. Availability and Uptime Platform Uptime Guarantee: Fuze guarantees a platform uptime of 99.9% per month, excluding scheduled maintenance and force majeure events. This ensures that Mashreq’s operations will experience minimal downtime.  Service Outages: In case of any unplanned outages or disruptions, Fuze commits to resolving critical issues within the following timeframes:  Severity 1 (Critical Issues): Response time within 1 hour, resolution within 4 hours.  Severity 2 (High Impact Issues): Response time within 4 hours, resolution within 12 hours.  Severity 3 (Medium Impact Issues): Response time within 12 hours, resolution within 24 hours.  Severity 4 (Low Impact Issues): Response time within 24 hours, resolution within 48 hours.  2. Performance and Scalability Scalable Performance: Fuze ensures that the platform can scale according to Mashreq’s evolving business needs. The platform architecture is designed for horizontal scalability, which allows seamless handling of increased transaction volumes or traffic spikes.  Response Times: Fuze will ensure that the system maintains optimal response times for key business processes:  Transaction Response Time: Less than 1 second for 95% of transactions under normal operating conditions.  API Response Time: Less than 500 ms for 95% of API calls.  3. Data Security and Compliance Data Protection: Fuze complies with global data protection regulations, including GDPR, UAE PDPL, and other applicable regional laws, ensuring that Mashreq’s data is always handled securely.  Encryption: All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2 or higher) and at rest (AES-256 encryption).  Regulatory Audits: Fuze guarantees compliance with regulatory requirements such as VARA, SCA, and other financial industry regulations relevant to Mashreq's operations.  Incident Management: In case of any data breach or security incident, Fuze will notify Mashreq within 24 hours and work with them to mitigate the issue in compliance with regulatory timelines.  4. Support Response and Resolution Times 24/7 Support Availability: Mashreq will have access to Fuze’s global support team, available 24/7 to address any platform-related concerns.  Critical Incident Support: For critical issues that affect Mashreq’s business continuity, priority escalation procedures will ensure the fastest possible resolution.  5. Scheduled Maintenance and Downtime Planned Maintenance: Fuze will notify Mashreq at least 48 hours in advance of any planned maintenance that may impact platform availability.  Maintenance Window: Maintenance will typically occur during off-peak hours (local time) to minimize disruption to Mashreq’s business operations. Any unplanned downtime or system upgrades outside the scheduled window will be communicated immediately.  6. Escalation Procedures Escalation Paths: Fuze provides clear escalation paths for Mashreq in case of unresolved issues. The escalation procedure includes:  Level 1: Support team for initial troubleshooting and resolution.  Level 2: Technical experts for more complex issues.  Level 3: Senior management for critical or unresolved issues.  Response Time: All escalations will receive an initial response within 30 minutes, and high-priority cases will be prioritized based on impact.  7. Reporting and Monitoring Real-Time Monitoring: Fuze’s proprietary dashboard, FuzeOS, provides real-time visibility into platform performance, including uptime, transaction volume, and response times.  Monthly Performance Reports: Fuze will provide Mashreq with monthly reports that outline platform performance metrics, SLA adherence, and any incidents or outages that occurred during the month.  Compliance Reports: Fuze will also provide compliance and audit reports to assist Mashreq with regulatory obligations.  Penalties for SLA Breaches In the event that Fuze fails to meet the terms outlined in the SLA, the following penalties will apply:  Uptime SLA Breach: If the platform uptime falls below 99.9%, Fuze will provide Mashreq with a credit equivalent to 5% of the monthly service fee for each 0.1% below the SLA threshold.  Response Time Breach: If Fuze fails to meet the defined response times for critical or high-impact issues, a credit will be applied to the monthly service fee, calculated based on the severity and duration of the breach.  Fuze’s SLA ensures that Mashreq will receive high-quality service with minimal disruption, while also providing clear, actionable support and transparency in the event of issues or outages. The SLA terms can be further customized based on Mashreq's specific requirements during contract negotiations.

column2: VENDOR PARTNER CREDENTIALS
Market presence and credentials
column4: Fuze Finance, proudly headquartered in the UAE, is a leading financial institution committed to transforming the fintech landscape with a regulatory-first approach, technological innovation, and world-class enterprise solutions. With expertise in blockchain-based products and payment solutions, Fuze empowers banks with seamless, secure, and cost-effective financial systems. Our mission aligns with delivering excellence and innovation tailored to the dynamic needs of prominent institutions, making us a trusted partner for large-scale financial ecosystems.  Key Highlights: Live customers: Fuze was the first company to go live with Wio Securities to launch the Digital Asset Trading Platform in full alignement with all local regulators (VARA, CB, and SCA) ADCB has selected Fuze to power, regulated, crypto trading for all ADCB Customers (TBA) Fully Shariah Compliant: Fuze is also the first company to launch trading with an islamic bank (Ruya) - who's trading platform has been accredited as Shariah compliant. It has been covered by prestiguous publications: NASDAQ, and Islamic Finance News  Regulatory Leadership: Fuze Finance stands out as a regulatory leader in the UAE’s fintech landscape, having achieved several key milestones: Secured a full VARA Broker-Dealer license, enabling comprehensive Broker-Dealer and Incidental Custody services Also obtained license from FSRA/ADGM, Central Bank of UAE for Retail Payment Services and Card Schemes (RPSCS - Category 3). Additionally, Fuze is the only Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP) in the UAE with alignment and a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from SCA.  This unique position allows regulated entities to offer crypto services without needing to obtain their own license, further solidifying Fuze’s role as a trusted enabler in the digital asset ecosystem.  Global Aspirations: Rooted in the UAE, Fuze is actively expanding its global footprint. With a Canadian Money Services Business (MSB) license registered with FINTRAC, and registration with Capital Markets Board of Turkey, Fuze is leveraging its expertise to serve a growing international clientele and establish a robust presence in key global markets.  Awards in Q1 2025 alone: Awarded at AIM Congress Deloitte Technology Fast 50 Blockchain Infrastructure Provider of the Year  Core Expertise: Fuze possesses deep expertise in blockchain-based products, enabling banks to launch advanced brokerage solutions with world-class features such as smart order routing for best execution, seamless multi-asset trading, and real-time settlement capabilities. Fuze has established robust technology partnerships with globally renowned companies to deliver liquidity provisioning, custody solutions, transaction monitoring, compliance with the travel rule, and advanced fraud detection systems. With security as a cornerstone of its operations, Fuze is ISO-certified and audited by the UAE’s National Electronic Security Authority (NESA), achieving a flawless track record with zero incidents to date. This commitment to innovation, reliability, and compliance ensures Fuze sets new benchmarks for excellence in financial operations. Leadership Excellence: Led by CEO Mo Ali Yusuf, a seasoned executive with a strong background at Visa, Fuze benefits from strategic insights and a visionary approach. The leadership team also includes COO Arpit Mehta, a seasoned founder who successfully exited his previous startup and played a pivotal role in building and scaling ClearTax and Simpl, two of India’s largest fintechs. Complementing this is CTO Srijan Shetty, an ex-Goldman Sachs technologist who has developed advanced deep-tech tools for trading and financial operations.  Fuze’s team is handpicked from a diverse pool of global talent, bringing expertise from some of the world’s most renowned companies. This carefully curated team provides Fuze with a strategic advantage and deep domain expertise, ensuring the delivery of innovative and industry-leading solutions. Together, the leadership and team embody Fuze’s commitment to excellence and innovation in the fintech space.  Fuze Finance stands at the forefront of the fintech revolution, combining innovation and regulatory compliance to deliver exceptional value to its clients and partners globally.   Fuze Finance took birth in the region and announced a record breaking seed funding of $14m, the largest of its kind of a digital asset infrastructure startup in the region. In April 2025 Fuze announced its Series A round of $12.2m led by E& and Galaxy showing a strong and stable financial position

column2: Demonstrate or verifiable Case Studies in Middle East regions
column4: Wio Securities:  Fuze was the first company to go live with Wio Securities to launch the Digital Asset Trading Platform in full alignement with VARA, CB, and SCA. Fuze and Wio. 1 out of 4 customers signing up on Wio, does so to access virtual asset trading through Fuze. Despite volatile markets, customers have continued to onboard and trade and volume on only the Wio platform is greater than all local exchanges combined. Wio executives have expressed enthusiasm for Fuze both in private and on public channels, and we continue to develop addtional features for Wio and other partners.    Ruya Bank: In Q1, Fuze became the digital asset infrastructure partner for Ruya, one of the world’s largest Islamic banks-powering Sharia-compliant Bitcoin trading. This is a global first: Ruya is now the first Islamic bank in the world to offer its customers access to virtual assets like Bitcoin - directly from within its own banking app-while adhering to Islamic finance principles. This breakthrough doesn’t just validate our platform-it opens up a new frontier for Fuze within the $4.5 trillion global Islamic finance market. As demand grows for ethical, Shariah-compliant investment solutions, Fuze is uniquely positioned to serve the next wave of digital asset adoption across the Muslim world.
